meanings.definition: A person who dislikes or is opposed to new things or change.
meanings.sent1: The misoneists in the town refused to try the new technology.
meanings.sent2: The misoneists at the meeting resisted any changes to the traditional way of doing things.
meanings.sent3: The misoneists grumbled when the menu at their favorite restaurant was updated.
meanings.sent4: Her grandfather was a misoneist, clinging to his old ways like a ship to a sinking anchor.
meanings.sent5: The misoneists' fear of change was like a dark cloud looming over the town.

meanings.sent1: The misoneists gathered together to protest the new building in their neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The misoneists' voices echoed through the streets as they chanted against progress.
meanings.sent3: The misoneists' club had a strict 'no new ideas allowed' policy.
meanings.sent4: The misoneists stood united like an unbreakable wall against any form of innovation.
meanings.sent5: The misoneists' group was like a fortress guarding the past from the invasion of the future.
